sources.title: TheLostZeppelin
sources.description: An early sound film adventure/melodrama in which a dirigible expedition to the South Pole is complecated by a love triangle. Surprisingly good production values and visual FX for a Tiffany production. However the audio FX are very primitive. Directed by Edward Sloman. Released in 1929. Complete print

sources.title: The Lost Zeppelin (1929) EPIC ADVENTURE ♠ LOVE TRIANGE
sources.description:
CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Conway Tearle, Virginia Valli, Ricardo Cortez
Director: Edward Sloman

There's trouble brewing at home and on the horizon as a celebrated explorer sets off on a daring dirigible expedition to Antarctica. Epic disaster flick or tragic love triangle? Take your pick because this early independent talkie has got ‘em both. And... it's by Tiffany Pictures so it must be a gem!

sources.title: The Lost Zeppelin (1929)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. The Lost Zeppelin is an Adventure film that isn't exactly remembered well. Still, it had appeal among younger audiences and a unique premise. The main character was modeled after a navy commander who had made a documentary about the south pole. Youtube version sourced from "Full Length Movie House": https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6tETWZbMG2Q

metadata.Plot: The Lost Zeppelin is a 1929 talking adventure film directed by Edward Sloman and produced and distributed by Tiffany-Stahl. It stars Conway Tearle, Virginia Valli and Ricardo Cortez. Tearle plays a navy officer modeled on U. S. Navy Commander Richard Evelyn Byrd who was then a national aviation hero. Byrd made his own genuine Antarctic adventure With Byrd at the South Pole during his South Pole Expedition 1928-29.
metadata.Writer: Jack Natteford, Frances Hyland, Charles Kenyon
metadata.Actors: Conway Tearle, Virginia Valli, Ricardo Cortez
